11 def exit_gracefully(signum, frame):
12  """
13  This function enables a Ctrl+C interruption during running.
14  :param signum: pass
15  :param frame: pass
16  :return: none
17  """
18  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, original_sigint)
19 
20  sys.exit(1)

22  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, exit_gracefully)
23 
24 class motor_commander:
25  """
26  This function is a control infrastructure based on basic CAN communication written in motor_test.py
27  """
28  def __init__(self):
29  """
30  Initialization
31  """
32  rospy.init_node('motor_commander', anonymous = True)
33  self.motorIDs = [1]
34  self.robot_joint_state = np.zeros(len(self.motorIDs))
35 
36  rospy.loginfo('motor commander initialised')
37 
38  self.pub_states = []
39  self.pub_commands = []
40  self.sub_states = []
41  for id in self.motorIDs:
42  self.pub_states.append(rospy.Publisher('motor_state/'+str(id)+'/', tmotor_cmd, queue_size = 10))
43  self.pub_commands.append(rospy.Publisher('motor_command/'+str(id)+'/', tmotor_cmd, queue_size = 10))
44  # Also read the can responses
45  self.sub_states.append(rospy.Subscriber('can_response/motor_'+str(id), tmotor_data, self.joint_state_callback, id))
46 
47  rospy.loginfo('publishers initialised')
48 
49  # Make sure that there is a subscriber to the node
50  # Establish connection to the subscriber before publishing anything
51  for idx in range(len(self.motorIDs)):
52  while self.pub_states[idx].get_num_connections() == 0:
53  print("Establishing connection with...", self.motorIDs[idx])
54  rospy.Rate(50).sleep()
55  pass
56 
57  def joint_state_callback(self, data, id):
58  """
59  This function updates motor position data.
60  :param data: incoming motor data
61  :param id: motor id
62  :return: none
63  """
64  if id == 1:
65  self.robot_joint_state[0] = data.position
66 
67  def armMotor(self, idx):
68  """
69  This function arms the motor.
70  :param idx: motor ID
71  :return: none
72  """
73  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
74  cmd.status = True
75  # self.pub_states[idx].publish(cmd)
76  # # Set kp and kd to 0
77  # cmd = tmotor_cmd()
78  cmd.setzero = False
79  cmd.position = 0
80  cmd.velocity = 0
81  cmd.torque = 0
82  cmd.kp = 0
83  cmd.kd = 0
84  self.pub_states[idx].publish(cmd)
85  rospy.loginfo('motor armed')
86  time.sleep(0.3)
87 
88  def setZero(self, idx):
89  """
90  This function sets the current motor position as zero position.
91  :param idx: motor ID
92  :return: none
93  """
94  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
95  cmd.status = True
96  cmd.setzero = True
97  # self.pub_states[idx].publish(cmd)
98  # # Then immediately send the command to move to zero
99  # cmd = tmotor_cmd()
100  cmd.position = 0
101  cmd.velocity = 0
102  cmd.torque = 0
103  cmd.kp = 0
104  cmd.kd = 0
105  self.pub_commands[idx].publish(cmd)
106 
107  def disarmMotor(self, idx):
108  """
109  This function disarms the motor.
110  :param idx: motor ID
111  :return: none
112  """
113  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
114  cmd.position = 0
115  cmd.velocity = 0
116  cmd.torque = 0
117  cmd.kp = 0
118  cmd.kd = 0
119  # self.pub_states[idx].publish(cmd)
120  # cmd = tmotor_cmd()
121  cmd.status = False
122  cmd.setzero = False
123  self.pub_states[idx].publish(cmd)
124  rospy.loginfo('motor disarmed')
125  time.sleep(0.3)
126 
127  def setAngle(self, idx, angle, kp, kd):
128  """
129  This function only sends angular position data to the motor.
130  :param idx:motor ID
131  :param angle: angle that needs to be set
132  :param kp: proportional factor
133  :param kd: differential factor
134  :return:none
135  """
136  # !!! Since the motor command is now a different topic, we
137  # might want to use a different mesgs to set the control mode etc.
138  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
139  cmd.status = True
140  cmd.setzero = False
141  # The input angle is in degrees
142  cmd.position = angle
143  cmd.velocity = 0
144  cmd.torque = 0
145  # This ensures that we are in the position only mode
146  cmd.kp = kp # 20
147  cmd.kd = kd # 4
148  self.pub_commands[idx].publish(cmd)
149  rospy.loginfo('Angle Set')
150 
151 
152  def setCommand(self, idx, angle, velocity, kp, kd):
153  """
154  This function sends position, velocity data to the motor.
155  :param idx: motor ID
156  :param angle: position command
157  :param velocity: velocity command
158  :param kp: proportional factor
159  :param kd: differential factor
160  :return: none
161  """
162  # !!! Since the motor command is now a different topic, we
163  # might want to use a different mesgs to set the control mode etc.
164  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
165  cmd.status = True
166  cmd.setzero = False
167  # The input angle is in degrees
168  cmd.position = angle
169  cmd.velocity = velocity
170  cmd.torque = 0
171  # This ensures that we are in the position only mode
172  cmd.kp = kp # 20
173  cmd.kd = kd # 4
174  self.pub_commands[idx].publish(cmd)
175 
176  def armAll(self):
177  """
178  This function arms all the motors.
179  :return: none
180  """
181  for idx in range(len(self.motorIDs)):
182  self.armMotor(idx)
183  time.sleep(0.3)
184 
185  def disarmAll(self):
186  """
187  This function disarms all the motors.
188  :return: none
189  """
190  for idx in range(len(self.motorIDs)):
191  self.disarmMotor(idx)
192  time.sleep(0.3)
193 
194  def setZeroAll(self):
195  """
196  This function sets current position of all the motors to zero position.
197  :return:
198  """
199  for idx in range(len(self.motorIDs)):
200  self.setZero(idx)
201  time.sleep(0.3)
202 
203  def holdCurrentPose(self):
204  """
205  This function holds current position for all the motors with very large stiffness.
206  :return: none
207  """
208  # First arm all motors to update the joint state
209  self.armAll()
210  # get the current joint pose of the robot
211  rospy.loginfo("Holding state: {}".format(self.robot_joint_state))
212  # move the robot to its current pose so that it holds
213  hold_kp = 100
214  hold_kd = 0
215  for ii in range(len(self.robot_joint_state)):
216  self.setAngle(ii, self.robot_joint_state[ii],hold_kp,hold_kd)
217  time.sleep(0.3)
218 
219  def readCurrentPassivePositions(self):
220  """
221  This function disarms the motor twice and read the current joint states.
222  :return:none
223  """
224  # disarm twice to update the current joint position
225  self.disarmAll()
226  self.disarmAll()
227  # print the joint state
228  rospy.loginfo("{}".format(self.robot_joint_state))
229  print(self.robot_joint_state)
230 
231  def setTorque(self,idx, torque):
232  """
233  This function only sends torque command to the motor.
234  :param idx: motor ID
235  :param torque: torque command
236  :return: none
237  """
238  # torque control
239  if abs(torque) > 3:
240  self.disarmMotor(idx)
241  rospy.loginfo('set torque exceeds safety')
242  else:
243  cmd = tmotor_cmd()
244  cmd.status = True
245  cmd.setzero = False
246  cmd.position = 0
247  cmd.velocity = 0
248  cmd.torque = torque
249  cmd.kp = 0
250  cmd.kd = 0
251  self.pub_commands[idx].publish(cmd)
252 
253 
254 # Class for interpolating positions and velocities
255 # Inherits the motor_commander class to send commands
256 class trajTracker(motor_commander):
257  """
258  This function is for trajectory planning and tracking.
259  """
260  def __init__(self):
261  """
262  initialization
263  """
264  # initate the motor_commander
265  super().__init__()
266  # in seconds
267  self.tf = 0
268  self.control_frequency = 0.1
269  # desired angle in degrees
270  self.qd = np.array([0])
271  # initial angle
272  self.qi = np.array([0])
273  # get desired and final velocities
274  self.vi = np.array([0])
275  self.vd = np.array([0])
276  self.interpolation_method = "linear"
277  # set current real-time
278  self.t0 = 0
279  # save coeffs for cubic
280  self.cc = np.empty(4)
281  # Setup container to track open loop trajectories loaded
282  self.generated_traj = {}
283 
284  # Pass t0 when the loop started and tc the current time
285  def get_ref_pos(self, t0, tc):
286  """
287  This function calculates the difference between current state and reference state.
288  It is for feedback control.
289  :param t0: start time
290  :param tc: current time
291  :return: theta,dtheta
292  """
293  tn = tc-t0
294  if self.interpolation_method == "linear":
295  theta = self.qi*(1-tn/self.tf)+self.qd*tn/self.tf
296 
297 
298  dtheta = np.zeros(len(self.motorIDs))
299  return theta, dtheta
300  # use cubic interpolation for moving between positions to use velocity
301  if self.interpolation_method == "cubic":
302  # modify this to assert
303  # if self.cc.any() == 0:
304  # print(self.cc)
305  # raise Exception("Cubic requires interpolation coeffs.")
306  # else:
307  # print(self.cc)
308  theta = self.cc[0]*tn**3+self.cc[1]*tn**2+self.cc[2]*tn+self.cc[3]
309  dtheta = 3*self.cc[0]*tn**2++2*self.cc[1]*tn+self.cc[2]
310  return theta, dtheta
311  if self.interpolation_method == "cubic_pos":
312  theta = self.cc[0]*tn**3+self.cc[1]*tn**2+self.cc[2]*tn+self.cc[3]
313  dtheta = np.zeros(len(self.motorIDs))
314  return theta, dtheta
315  else:
316  pass
317 
318  def compute_cc(self):
319  """
320  This function generates factors for cubic interpolation.
321  :return: cubic interpolation factors
322  """
323  self.cc[0] = (-2*(self.qd-self.qi)-self.tf*(self.vd+self.vi))/self.tf**3
324  self.cc[1] = -(-3*(self.qd-self.qi)+self.tf*(self.vd+2*self.vi))/self.tf**2
325  self.cc[2] = self.vi
326  self.cc[3] = self.qi
327 
328  # Generate the required trajectory from the save values and dt value
329  def generate_trajectory(self, N):
330  """
331  This function generates a series of command of position and velocity.
332  :param N: number of steps
333  :return: lists of position and velocity commands
334  """
335  t_list = np.linspace(self.t0, self.tf, N)
336  pos_list = []
337  vel_list = []
338  if self.interpolation_method == "linear":
339  [pos_list.append(self.qi*(1-tn/self.tf)+self.qd*tn/self.tf) for tn in t_list]
340  [vel_list.append(np.zeros(len(self.motorIDs))) for tn in t_list]
341  self.generated_traj['time'] = t_list
342  self.generated_traj['des_pos'] = np.array(pos_list)
343  self.generated_traj['des_vel'] = np.array(vel_list)
344 
345  # use cubic interpolation for moving between positions to use velocity
346  if self.interpolation_method == "cubic":
347  t_list = np.linspace(self.t0, self.tf, N)
348  [pos_list.append(self.cc[0]*tn**3+self.cc[1]*tn**2+self.cc[2]*tn+self.cc[3]) for tn in t_list]
349  [vel_list.append(3*self.cc[0]*tn**2++2*self.cc[1]*tn+self.cc[2]) for tn in t_list]
350  self.generated_traj['time'] = t_list
351  self.generated_traj['des_pos'] = np.array(pos_list)
352  self.generated_traj['des_vel'] = np.array(vel_list)
353 
354 
355  if self.interpolation_method == "cubic_pos":
356  t_list = np.linspace(self.t0, self.tf, N)
357  [pos_list.append(self.cc[0]*tn**3+self.cc[1]*tn**2+self.cc[2]*tn+self.cc[3]) for tn in t_list]
358  [vel_list.append(np.zeros(len(self.motorIDs))) for tn in t_list]
359  self.generated_traj['time'] = t_list
360  self.generated_traj['des_pos'] = np.array(pos_list)
361  self.generated_traj['des_vel'] = np.array(vel_list)
362  else:
363  pass
364 
365 
366  def track_trajectory(self):
367  """
368  This function executes the list of position and velocity command generated from generate_trajectory(self,N)
369  :return: none
370  """
371  # Read current time
372  self.t0 = time.time()
373  tc = time.time()-self.t0
374  while self.tf >= tc:
375  # ideally compute qd in each id loop because we're sleeping a lot
376  qr, dqr = self.get_ref_pos(self.t0, time.time())
377  # print(np.array(qr), np.array(dqr))
378  for idx in range(len(self.motorIDs)):
379  # self.setCommand(idx, qr[idx], dqr[idx], 20, 4)
380  kp = 20
381  kd = 4
382  self.setCommand(idx, qr, dqr, kp, kd)
383  time.sleep(self.control_frequency)
384  tc = time.time()-self.t0
385  print(tc, qr, dqr)
386 
387

389  original_sigint = signal.getsignal(signal.SIGINT)
390  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, exit_gracefully)
